subject: Leadership
title: Psychological Safety
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Psychological Safety.

hook.text: Google studied its best teams. Talent, tenure, and structure didn't predict success. One factor did: felt safety.

buildup.text: Edmondson: it's believing you won't be punished for speaking up, making mistakes, or asking questions.

discovery.text: Safe teams learn faster, innovate more, and catch errors earlier. Fear doesn't drive performance. It drives silence.

twist.text: Safety doesn't mean comfort. High-performing teams pair safety with high standards. Kindness and accountability coexist.

climax.text: Build safety: admit your own mistakes, thank people for bad news, and respond to failure with curiosity, not blame.

punchline.text: People can't do their best work when they're afraid.

quiz.question: What did Google's Project Aristotle find was the top factor for team success?
